quality_assessment: Excellent documentation with comprehensive coverage of all mapped features. Content is accurate, well-organized, and includes practical examples. No significant drift detected.
positive_aspects: Comprehensive event tracking documentation with all event types accurately documented (AgentStarted, AgentCompleted, AgentFailed, WorkItemProcessed, CheckpointSaved, ClaudeMessage)
ClaudeMessage event type properly documented at lines 81-91 with correct JSON structure including agent_id, content, message_type, and json_log_location fields
Claude observability section thoroughly covers json_log_location tracking per Spec 121
Verbosity control levels clearly explained with practical usage examples
Excellent correlation ID documentation with code references (src/storage/types.rs:75) and practical query examples at lines 291-322
Practical debugging examples for MapReduce failures
Complete log analysis examples with jq commands
Accurate cross-references to related pages with all links verified (event-tracking.md, dead-letter-queue-dlq.md, sessions.md)
Performance metrics section covers token usage and timing
Log management section with cleanup commands and 'prodigy logs' command documented
Event organization structure matches global storage architecture
Event query examples show real-world usage patterns including correlation ID filtering
improvement_suggestions: Consider adding a table of contents at the top for easier navigation of long page
Could add a 'Quick Start' section for common debugging scenarios
Consider adding diagrams showing event flow through the system
Could include examples of setting up event monitoring dashboards
Add section on interpreting common error patterns in logs
Consider adding troubleshooting guide for when logs are missing or corrupted
Could add comparison table of all event types with their purposes for quick reference

metadata.validation_focus: Check event logging, Claude log tracking, and verbosity settings are documented

event_tracking.coverage: All event types documented with JSON examples and practical usage

claude_observability.coverage: JSON log location tracking, log contents, accessing logs, and analysis tools fully documented

verbosity_control.coverage: All four verbosity levels documented with usage examples and environment override
